entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is described as waltzing with Madame Maxime. He is dwarfed by her, but she moves graciously for a woman of her size.

entities.name: madame maxime
entities.description: Madame Maxime is described as waltzing with Dumbledore. She is large and moves graciously, but her size makes it difficult for Dumbledore to reach the top of his hat.

entities.name: mad-eye moody
entities.description: Mad-Eye Moody is described as doing an extremely ungainly two-step with Professor Sinistra. He has a wooden leg and his magical eye stares through Harry's robes.

entities.name: professor sinistra
entities.description: Professor Sinistra is described as nervously avoiding Mad-Eye Moody's wooden leg while they dance the two-step.

entities.name: dobby
entities.description: Dobby is mentioned as having knitted socks for Harry. He is described as creepy by Parvati.

entities.name: parvati
entities.description: Parvati is described as whispering to Harry about Mad-Eye Moody's magical eye and Dobby being creepy. She is excited about the music and wants to stay.

entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: Harry Potter is mentioned as wearing socks knitted by Dobby. He grins when talking to Mad-Eye Moody and lets go of Parvati during the music.

entities.name: the weird sisters
entities.description: The Weird Sisters are described as playing bagpipes and then striking up a new song. They fill the hall with applause and music.

relationships.description: Dumbledore is described as waltzing with Madame Maxime. This relationship is mentioned in the first sentence of the chapter.
Mad-Eye Moody is described as doing an extremely ungainly two-step with Professor Sinistra. This relationship is mentioned in the second sentence of the chapter.
Mad-Eye Moody passes by Harry and says 'Nice socks, Potter' while staring through his robes with his magical eye. This relationship is mentioned in the third sentence of the chapter.
Parvati whispers to Harry about Mad-Eye Moody's magical eye and Dobby being creepy. This relationship is mentioned in the fourth sentence of the chapter.
Harry lets go of Parvati during the music. This relationship is mentioned in the sixth sentence of the chapter.
